name: Toronto Outdoor Art Fair - TOAF64
description:
Established in 1961, this is Canada's leading outdoor and online art fair. 

Showcasing over 400 emerging and established visual artists, including painters, photographers, and sculptors. Now in its 64th year, meet and collect art from artists from across Canada. Don't miss a spectacular weekend filled with art installations, art tours, family programming, music, dance, great food and drinks! 

Not in Toronto? Buy art online, catch our Instagram live artist chats or studio tours and browse curated collections at our website below.

name: The Professionals Comedy Show - Toronto's Best Stand-Up Comedy
description:
When amateur comedy isn't doing the job, it's time to call The Professionals. A line-up of Toronto's most acclaimed comics come together to leave you in stitches! The performance space is perfect for an intimate standup comedy show.

This month's headliner:
Hershawn Arora (@rapsandlaughs)

Hershawn Arora is Toronto's brightest young comic. In 2023, he debuted with Just For Laughs by recording a Just For Laughs Originals EP and was named an International Roast Battle All-Star. A fan-favourite at all Toronto comedy clubs, Hershawn has been recognized as one of the most promising acts in the country and is blazing his trail to becoming a nationwide headliner.

Opening acts are to be determined.

name: Afro Colombian Party with La Chiva Gantiva
description:
Beginning in 2004 in Brussels, when three Colombian students started playing percussion together. They blend Afro-Colombian rhythms like champeta, chirimia and mapale, with rock, Afrobeat and funk for a completely unique and energetic sound. The UK Times described their live show as a "frenetic carnival-punk racket that detonates like a Molotov cocktail of rock, rap, soul and ferociously funky Latin rhythms".  

La Chiva Gantiva is not just a band but an artistic collective, led by Rafael Espinel, integrating music, video clips, documentaries, and a meticulously crafted visual identity.

name: Forestry Talk at Steeles Library
description:
Toronto has one of the largest urban forests in the world. Join City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff for an in-library presentation on this amazing natural habitat that reaches all corners of Toronto. Learn about what makes the urban forest so special and share tools to explore and understand it better. Bring questions and curiosities and leave with emboldened confidence and understanding of your City and the natural world that surrounds you!

The presentation is designed for adults, but anyone can attend. Children requiring supervision must have an adult in attendance.

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs
